DataElement.preferredName: Current Disease Second Malignant Neoplasm Assessment Last Follow-up Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date of the last examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction of a second unique primary tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues as a disease that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Current Disease Second Malignant Neoplasm Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to current examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction of a second unique primary tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues as a disease that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the date of the last follow-up, information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

The process by which information about the health status of an individual is obtained after a study has officially closed; an activity that continues something that has already begun or that repeats something that has already been done.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
